title: Computer-Supported Mathematical Problem-Solving Project for Collaborative Learning

context.additional_context: A process of conducting math problem-solving projects in collaborative learning environments using digital devices. Utilizing CSCL (Computer Supported Collaborative Learning) tools to promote learner interaction

learning_goals: Learners can perform effective interactions with peers while solving complex mathematical problems using collaborative learning tools.
Learners can enhance their mathematical modeling skills and strengthen their ability to apply mathematical concepts to real-world problems through project-based activities.
Learners can establish learning strategies that reflect self-reflection and peer feedback during collaborative learning through formative assessment.

resources: Online collaboration tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
